page.title: 17Ocker Hill Power Station
page.content: One of the most important features of the Tipton skyline for the greater part of 20 years hass been the power station at Ocker Hill. The concrete cooling towers opened in 1968 replaced the much older wooden ones, and now these are destined to be demolished late in 1985 having been replaced by a modern power station. The two smaller towers are 263 feet tall and were capable of cooling 1,680,000 gallons of water per hour, and the larger tower, also 263 feet high was capable of cooling 2,376,000 gallons of water per hour.
